subject: Personal Finance
title: Crises Follow Patterns
description: A quick, practical guide to Crises Follow Patterns.

hook.text: Every crisis is different. Every crisis is the same. The pattern is boom, denial, panic, and reform.

buildup.text: Economist Hyman Minsky described how stability breeds risk-taking, which breeds instability.

discovery.text: The 'Minsky Moment' is when overleveraged borrowers can no longer cover their debts. Collapse follows.

twist.text: Each generation thinks 'this time is different.' It never is. Human psychology repeats the cycle.

climax.text: Knowing the pattern doesn't prevent it â€” but it can help you prepare personally for the next one.

punchline.text: Stability is destabilizing. That's the paradox.

quiz.question: What is a 'Minsky Moment'?
options: When overleveraged borrowers can no longer service their debts
